Leaves: Large and broad lower down, becoming much finer and more divided higher up.
Flowers: Large circular clusters of small whitish flowers on stalks, typical carrot family (Apiaceae) flowers.
FruitSeeds: Oblong to oval-shaped. With prominent ribs.
Habitat: Disturbed areas, pastures, wetlands, arid areas, old gardens.
DistinguishingFeatures: Broad leaves of lower sections graduating to narrow divided leaves distinguish from others in carrot family (Apiaceae).
